Articles.Content:
**T-34 1940**

**Designer: Zekes**

**Status:****COMPLETED**

**Cost: $194,284.60**

**Comes with rotating turret (just decouple from the body and switch to it). Make sure to use forward-facing docking ports to "control from here", since the control pods are often the wrong way around. Automatically set to have the middle three wheels non-operationall to allow high-speed turning. Camoflage not included.**

***Download:*** [***http://www./download/2g48anb9kxyfwv9/T-34+1940.craft***](http://www./download/2g48anb9kxyfwv9/T-34+1940.craft)

![VkjFpQS.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/VkjFpQS.jpg)![pEbsJDc.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/pEbsJDc.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-21T17:52:53Z" title="06/21/2015 05:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 21, 2015</time> by zekes**

> 
> How many parts is it?

370ish, I believe.

> 
> This is epic :)i love it

More on their way ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![qc29lG7.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/qc29lG7.jpg)

Hey man, any chance we can see it without the kerbpaint? 

 She does look great!

It's actually not even Kerbpaint, I just edited the screenshots afterwards with an olive gloss and some other touches....

![UJtgmW6.png](http://i.imgur.com/UJtgmW6.png)

![y76osys.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/y76osys.jpg)

It's so cute ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Wish it was fully functional though.

> 
> It's so cute ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> Wish it was fully functional though.

well, the only thing it doesn't do is fire, and I could fix that with BD or even a stock weapon with one shot.
I couldn't distinguish it from the real thing. Well done!
This is amazing! I have to spread reputation around, but I will rep you. I don't know how you do it!

> 
> This is amazing! I have to spread reputation around, but I will rep you. I don't know how you do it!

Thank you ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

How I do it? Complete disregard for part count, lots of experience in part clipping, some three-plan drawings in front of me, and really good eye for what details are needed to make it look right. I had to widen the body twice, when it started it was toothpick skinny XD.

Here's the T-34 1940 and T-34 1942 next to each other. 1942 will be released soon.

![wuPWT0B.png](http://i.imgur.com/wuPWT0B.png)

> 
> It's actually not even Kerbpaint, I just edited the screenshots afterwards with an olive gloss and some other touches....
> [http://i.imgur.com/UJtgmW6.png](http://i.imgur.com/UJtgmW6.png)
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/y76osys.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/y76osys.jpg)

Explains the kerb paint working on things that it is not supposed to work on...

> 
> Explains the kerb paint working on things that it is not supposed to work on...

Yeah, that and It's so laborious to paint everything the same color ![-_-](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_sleep.png)

So, I'm working on the T-34-85 right now, and I'll release all three of them together once that's done. I hope you guys like them!
